channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: On Month of the Ocean, groups call for policies that will protect country's seas
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The groups warned that uncontrolled production and use of single-use plastics and indiscriminate disposal of plastic and other pollutants pose threat to the health of the world’s oceans as well as the survival of humans and other life forms.

item.title: NGO calls for maternal, child health services as more babies, young children contract COVID-19
item.description: A non-government organization on Thursday sounded the alarm on the rising number of children affected by the novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), calling on local health centers to resume maternal and child health services.

item.title: Andanar decries 'unfair' international media reporting on Duterte's ties over ABS-CBN closure
item.description: “Such claims are bereft of truth and just a rehash of an old malicious imputation to bedevil the President and his administration,” Communications Secretary Martin Andanar said.

item.title: ‘Health workers migration ban legal’
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Stopping the migration of healthcare workers to protect them from coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is perfectly legal, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Senate to prioritize passage of stimulus budget
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Senate will prioritize the passage of legislation in the coming months to revive the economy battered by the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis, including the 2021 national budget that might reach P5 trillion, Sen. Sonny Angara said yesterday.

item.title: Pinoys join blood drive for Italy
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Filipinos joined the blood drive to help Italy’s coronavirus disease 2019 response.

item.title: 40,000 displaced OFWs coming home
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Overseas Workers Welfare Administration reported yesterday that over 40,000 more overseas Filipino workers displaced by the lockdown abroad due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic are expected to return home.

item.title: DepEd: Curriculum to undergo changes
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education yesterday said it would implement adjustments in the basic education curriculum to take into account the current situation brought about by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Duterte institutionalizes ‘Balik-Probinsya’ program
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has signed Executive Order 114, which seeks to institutionalize the Balik Probinsya, Bagong Pag-Asa program as “a pillar of balanced regional development.”

item.title: DILG: SAP fund distribution may be extended anew
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government is eyeing another extension in the distribution of the social amelioration program as there are still issues in the handing out of financial assistance to qualified beneficiaries, particularly in Metro Manila.
